1.content:
Meeting with Mas Puja dan Kak Angeli:
  • Bagaimana menganalisis dari profile orang dengan perbedaan kampus, competitive modeling (SFIA) (setiap orang mau ada report → recommendation next coursenya apa?)
  • Goal: design a recommendation learning path
  • ITS → belajar untuk memanfaatkan AI, tau skill gapsnya gimana → kasih solusi cara belajar/learning path selanjutnya harus gimana
  • SFIA → nilai acuan untuk bidang IT, (transkrip nilai) levelnya berapa?
  • Penerapan SFIA (ada 121 skills): ada 7 level (7 - expert), misal software engineering butuh skill a level x, skill b level x, skill c levey y | misal kemampuan orang ini se-B tapi actual level skill yang diperluin untuk menjadi xxx butuh mencapai se-A → ada skill gap → ini yang harus dibantu dengan personalized learning, apa yang perlu dilakukan orang ini selanjutnya?
  • SFIA memudahkan dalam proses rekognasi kompetensi seseorang → menjadi standard untuk mengetahui sekill seeseorang dengan lebih jelas dan terukur
  • Teaching strategy → learning path → graph kalau bisa ga statik → gimana caranya? kasih rekomendasi → berdasarkan student model dengan nama, dan penilaian masing masing di bidangnya (contoh detail: software - A, database - B) → personalized based on orangnya (background datanya gimana? ranking? terlalu jauh gapnya bisa jadi burned out → kasih solusi yang feasible)
  • Modeling + pembobotan
  • Reinforcement learning
  • To do: Internship proposal (include best case & worst case) (DONE)

2.content:
Today's goals:
  • Continue working on putting the idea together: https://docs.google.com/document/d/11vOVoSQ4hJT_1DZXhYtQT_Vw_Su50ciL45PaxeScX-I/edit?usp=sharing
  • Mapping skills code in SFIA
Finished works:
  • Understanding SFIA skills and their details (what each skill covers + related topics).
  • I defined 5 tags to be focused on: [DATA] Data science, engineering, and analytics + AI | [DEVO] DevOps | [SOFT] Software Engineering | [CYBR] Information and cyber security | [CLOU] Cloud Computing (inside digital transformation view).
  • The full SFIA framework consists of 147 skills. I mapped each skill to one or more relevant tags and categorized them as core, non-technical, or additional/exploratory, using different colours. (File: SFIA - SFIA_Full_Framework.pdf)
  • Based on this annotated SFIA table, I created a visualization to illustrate the relationships between SFIA skills and heatmaps between codes-tags. (File: SFIA_Mapping_Insight.JPG (I annotated the related ideas here as well))
  • All related materials, including the SFIA CSV file and the code used to generate the SFIA connectivity visualization are maintained in my github's repo: https://github.com/sarahaikos/research-development-radyalabs (I will continue updating this repository as the work evolves).

3.content:
Meeting with Kak Angeli:
  • add learning objective + learner's learning goals (integrasi datanya lengkap & relevan sesuai tujuan learnernya)
  • [out of scope] contoh flow: ada feature untuk set learning goals/intention (career goal), skill aspiration, atau problem yang mau disolve, [alternative idea] instead of featurenya → make it as data → to be integrated with model
  • SOTA deliverables focusing on BKT, MLP, clustering
  • go deeper into the actual output + faktornya (terutama waktu) | hal yang terbayang dari sini: each individual has different learning speed → how to detect? effective? result? → assessment-based/project-based/interactive (?)
  • visuals: mastery progression, learner segmentation, path recommendation
  • prototype: personalized learning path recommendation, model: baseline, BKT, MLP, clustering
Based on these inputs, new detailed focus factors:
  • time: focus time, learning speed/study phase
  • understanding: mastery, engagement, mistakes
  • content: difficulty levels, learning map, format
  • decision-making logics: multiple valid next steps, explore more/constant topic, result progression
To do:
  • updated proposal (DONE)
  • ITS implementation idea

4.content:
Finished works:
  • Understanding the intelligent tutoring system concept
  • Built an idea of the required data and feature mapping based on the algorithms: Rule-Based, BKT, MLP, K-Means Clustering, DBSCAN, and RL (Data Requirement.pdf)
  • forgetting pattern* : related to this topic, I conducted additional research related to Ebbinghaus Forgetting Curve (Ebbinghaus Forgetting Curve.pdf)
  • Generated module title that might be related to SFIA and mapped it with the relevant skills (code in github repo)
Required data related to:
  • Learner profile → focus: distribution of learner backgrounds vs target skills, skill level imbalance
  • Learning activity & interaction → focus: time spent vs completion rate, time pattern long sessions effect lower success or not, fast vs slow learners across content difficulty level, engagement vs mastery correlation, passive vs active learner, burned out signals
  • Assessment & performance → focus: score distributions per skill and level, learning curves, error patterns per concept, and mastery insight
  • Content → focus: skill coverage gaps, content difficulty vs learner performance, and format effectiveness
  • Temporal & longitudinal → focus: forgetting pattern*, optimal review intervals, mastery stability, long term vs short term learners
  • Recommendation & decision → focus: accepetance rate per recommendation type, exploration patterns, recommendation diversity, feedback from user

5.content:
Today's focus: Rule-Based model ideation

Finished works:
  • I made a documentation regarding key points to consider when building my model, especially in rule-based modeling: skill and module structuring based on SFIA, mastery threshold, and rule priority (Research Focus.pdf)
  • I outlined pseudo logic required to build a rule-based model (Rule-Based Pesudo.pdf)
  • Based on the separate pseudo logic, I began writing the mathematical formulas related to those pseudo logics, and building the entire rule-based pipeline (Rule-Based Idea + Pipeline.pdf)
  • Additionally, I generated data based on the variables I needed to build the model, and I started building the rule-based model. I created the visualization as an overview of the current result. (File: recommendation_visualizations.png)
